frameDefinitions: The Agent is assigned to a Post where he or she performs a task associated with that Post.
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
A Whole separates into Parts, or one part of a whole, called Part_1, becomes separate from the remaining portion, Part_2.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
A Judge refrains from imposing, or demanding a punishment for an Evaluee who has committed an Offense.
frameExamples: On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
He <t>atoned</t> for his sin with good works.
This small channel meanders through marsh and wetland, <t>splitting</t> into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to a <fen>Post</fen> to perform a task involving a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Post</fen> is a location or station assigned to the <fen>Agent</fen> where a task or tasks are to be performed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is centrally involved in the task the <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to perform. It is normally located at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> works at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> staffs the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
The <fen>Agent</fen> has committed a <fen>Wrong</fen> and is making <fen>Amends</fen>.
<fen>Wrong</fen> identifies the act committed by the <fen>Agent</fen> for which <fen>Amends</fen> are made.
<fen>Amends</fen> marks expressions that indicate what the <fen>Agent</fen> does to compensate for the <fen>Wrong</fen> that was committed.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> atones for the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> expiates the <fen>Wrong</fen>.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which separates into <fen>Parts</fen>.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned.
Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Judge</fen> holds the <fen>Evaluee</fen> responsible for the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is subject to the judgment of the <fen>Judge</fen> for having committed the <fen>Offense</fen>.
The <fen>Offense</fen> is the illicit or unpleasant act committed by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Sue was staffing <fex>the entrance</fex> when everything started to go wrong.
You'll be working <fex>the phones</fex>.
Police manned the border <fex>from 3 to 5pm</fex>.
Working the front desk <fex>at a real estate office</fex> is not as fulfilling as it might seem.
Her <fex><t>tresses</t></fex> were golden.
<fex>Michael's</fex> hair is long.
I pulled Michael's  <fex>ponytail</fex>.
<fex>Syria</fex> has atoned for its support of Iraq.
Smithers is atoning <fex>for his misspent youth</fex>.
He atoned for his sin <fex>with good works</fex>.
<fex>Metalworkers' union</fex> to split into regional divisions
These daughter chromosomes then begin to separate <fex>from each other</fex>, each moving away from the metaphase plate and toward one of the two spindle pole regions.
Initially, <fex>the front part</fex> separated from the rest of the body.
Initially the front split <fex>from the rest of the body</fex>
However it is believed they separated <fex>at least 2 if not 3 million years ago</fex>.
The two parts likely separated <fex>above the Atlantic</fex>.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
God forgives <fex>repentant sinners</fex>.
Won't you forgive me <fex>for keeping it a secret</fex>?
